concise_definition: n. 折痕, 折叠处; v. 折叠, 折起, 崩溃

definitions.explanation_en: A crease or line formed when a flexible material such as paper, fabric, or skin is bent or doubled over on itself.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指当纸张、布料或皮肤等柔性材料被折叠或对折时形成的折痕或线条。
definitions.example_en: She carefully smoothed out the folds in her dress before the interview.
definitions.example_cn: 她在面试前仔细抚平了裙子上的褶皱。

definitions.explanation_en: A layer or section created by folding, especially in geological formations or in pastry dough, contributing to texture or structure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过折叠形成的层或部分，尤用于地质构造或面团中，以增强质地或结构。
definitions.example_en: The croissant has dozens of delicate folds that give it its flaky texture.
definitions.example_cn: 牛角面包有数十层细腻的折叠，使其具有酥脆的口感。

definitions.explanation_en: To bend something, especially a flat object, so that one part covers another, often to save space or prepare for storage.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将某物（尤其是扁平物体）折叠，使一部分覆盖另一部分，通常为了节省空间或便于存放。
definitions.example_en: He folded the map neatly and put it in his pocket.
definitions.example_cn: 他把地图整齐地折好，放进了口袋。

definitions.explanation_en: To fail or collapse under pressure, often used in the context of businesses, systems, or physical structures.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在压力下失败或崩溃，常用于企业、系统或物理结构。
definitions.example_en: The company folded after losing its major clients.
definitions.example_cn: 这家公司失去主要客户后倒闭了。

definitions.explanation_en: To incorporate something by gently mixing it into another substance, especially in cooking, to preserve airiness or texture.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在烹饪中轻柔地将一种物质混入另一种物质中，以保持其蓬松或质地，如将蛋白霜拌入面糊。
definitions.example_en: Gently fold the whipped cream into the batter to keep it light.
definitions.example_cn: 轻轻将打发的奶油拌入面糊中，以保持其轻盈的口感。

comparison.analysis: “Crease” (折痕) 通常指因折叠或压迫而形成的永久性或半永久性线条，强调痕迹本身，常用于描述衣物、纸张上的印记。而 “fold” 更强调折叠的动作或形成的层次结构，不一定留下永久痕迹。
“Bend” (弯曲) 指使物体发生弧形或非直角的变形，不一定形成清晰的折线，常用于描述柔软或可塑材料的形态变化。而 “fold” 通常指沿一条明确的线对折，形成锐角或直角的转折，更具结构性。
“Collapse” (坍塌) 指结构突然完全失去支撑而崩塌，常带有灾难性或不可逆的含义。而 “fold” 作为动词表示崩溃时，语气较轻，常用于商业或组织语境，暗示逐步或被动的失败，而非物理性崩塌。
